result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephon Ladaruis McArthur

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephon Ladaruis McArthur in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Stephon Ladaruis McArthur.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Jury Trial. Discussion on Defense motion to exclude testimony of Sgt. Burtch. Defense requests additional time to determine whether a formal motion should be filed. For reasons put forth on the record, court orders case adjourned. Jury Trial set for 10/10/2022 is vacated. Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Scheduling Conference. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephon Ladaruis McArthur in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Stephon Ladaruis McArthur.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final Pre-Trial.  Final Pre-trial proceeded.  Case remains in a jury trial posture. States offer put on the record. Defendant rejects States offer.  Court will only accept any plea negotiations as to all counts. Defense motion to exclude witness testimony heard and argued.  Court DENIES motion to exclude expert testimony of Analyst Lanphere.  Court takes under advisement motion to exclude testimony of Sgt. Burtch.  Defense intends to file Daubert Motion. Court orders motion with supporting documentation be filed by 10/10/2022 at 8:30 a.m. Court will not delay or adjourn the trial for any reasoning that could have been known by today. No objection to States Motions in Limine; Motions GRANTED. Pretrial check list placed on the record. 

Case passed to allow State time to share exhibits the State intends to use at trial. 
Case recalled at 10:13 a.m.  Parties need additional time, case passed.  
Case recalled at 10:24 a.m. Both parties are to have exhibit lists prepared by jury trial date and know how to operate any equipment if needed.  

Jury trial remains calendared for October 10, 2022 at 8:30 a.m. in Br. 9.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING( 9 pages) commencing 03-08-2022 by DANIELLE N. HOLCOMB.

Defendant Stephon Ladaruis McArthur in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is working on continued negotiations. Court sets 08/26/2022 as the deadline for the State to turn over all crime lab reports to Defense. 09/26/2022 is the deadline for any change of plea forms. 10/03/2022 is the deadline to file any final pretrial documents. 10/06/2022 is the final day Court will accept any negotiations. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Stephon Ladaruis McArthur in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Due to reasons stated on the record, court will not be extending any filing deadlines for motions. Court extended the filing deadline for defense to submit any change of plea forms to June 20th, 2022. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Stephon Ladaruis McArthur in court via zoom with attorney Katherine Graber.  Amy E. Spanczak for John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties before the court for scheduling.  The court set a deadline of 4/29 for the State to submit discovery to defense, with the exception of crime lab reports; The deadline to file any motions is 5/20/; if defendant decides on a change of plea, the forms must be filed by 5/27; the next court date in Br 17 is for continued pre trial conference.   mn  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Stephon Ladaruis McArthur in court with Attorney Katherine Graber; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Z. Cvetan. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stephon Ladaruis McArthur in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was not served. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Stephon Ladaruis McArthur in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/28/22 @ 1p
